title: Restless Legs Syndrome: Clinical Overview and Diagnostic Guidelines
short_description: A comprehensive clinical document describing restless legs syndrome (RLS), its symptoms, causes, demographics, and diagnostic approaches.
long_description: This clinical reference document provides a detailed overview of restless legs syndrome (RLS), a neurologic and sleep-related movement disorder characterized by an irresistible urge to move the legs accompanied by uncomfortable sensations. The document covers the characteristic symptoms including paresthesias and dysesthesias, the distinction between primary and secondary RLS, associated risk factors and underlying conditions, demographic patterns showing higher prevalence in women, and comprehensive diagnostic approaches including clinical evaluation, laboratory studies, and specialized assessments. It serves as a clinical guide for healthcare professionals in understanding and diagnosing this chronic condition that significantly impacts sleep and quality of life.
